info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 6:06PM EDT until May 12 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following counties, Broward, Miami-Dade and Palm Beach.
* WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 601 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rains with a line of thunderstorms moving east from the interior areas to the east coast metro areas of South Florida during the next couple of hours. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected with the incoming line of thunderstorms from the west. This amount of rainfall will fall on the already rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches from the morning showers and thunderstorms. This additional rainfall amounts will lead to possible minor flooding when the thunderstorms move into the flood advisory area. - If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast from these thunderstorms, then a Flash Flood warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Miami, Hialeah, Fort Lauderdale, Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Miramar, Coral Springs, West Palm Beach, Pompano Beach, Davie, Miami Beach, Plantation, Sunrise, Boca Raton, Deerfield Beach, Boynton Beach, Delray Beach, Tamarac, Wellington and Margate. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Broward, FL; Miami-Dade, FL; Palm Beach, FL
